results.title: You see, I've had a life
results.creator_credit: Ben Levin and Eccentric Circle Cinema Workshop
results.brief_description: Paul is a 13-year-old typical all-American boy, but with a difference - he has leukaemia. Fortunately his family does not seek to hide ten reality of his illness but tries to share and face the experience with him. The film is particularly useful with teenage children as they will readily identity with the principle subject.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ben Levin and Eccentric Circle Cinema Workshop
results.description: Paul is a 13-year-old typical all-American boy, but with a difference - he has leukaemia. results.title: You'll love New Orleans and she'll love you right back
results.creator_credit: Carolyn Ramsey and Carolyn Ramsey Productions
results.brief_description: Shows many aspects of New Orleans - the French style buildings, the Spanish style gardens. Looks at the sports and cultural activities, including jazz bands. Script, Carolyn Ramsey; photographer, Bill Delgado; commentator, John Pela.

results.title: Yirawala: Picasso of Arnhem Land
results.creator_credit: Sandra Holmes and Morning Star Productions
results.brief_description: Examines the sentiment and philosophy of artist Yirawala, MBE, spiritual leader of the Gunwingu tribe who fought to stop uranium mining and the destruction of his land and religion. Examines many of the bark paintings of Yirawala and the myths behind them.
results.description: Examines the sentiment and philosophy of artist Yirawala, MBE, spiritual leader of the Gunwingu tribe who fought to stop uranium mining and the destruction of his land and religion. Examines many of the bark paintings of Yirawala and the myths behind them.
